description.p: You are master of the hunt. The bounty of the land is yours for the taking.

td.em: hunter’s mark, strength of an ox
locate animals or plants, pass without trace

description.p: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency with longbows and heavy crossbows. You also gain proficiency in Nature and Survival.

At 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to camouflage yourself in any environment, gaining advantage on Stealth checks made to move quietly or to hide. You also leave no scent. The effect lasts for a number of rounds equal to your cleric level + your Wisdom modifier.

sheet.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to camouflage yourself in any environment, gaining advantage on Stealth checks made to move quietly or to hide. You also leave no scent. The effect lasts for {{undected:rounds}} rounds.

description.p: At 6th level, you can select a favored enemy as if you were a ranger. You gain all the benefits of the ranger’s Favored Enemy feature with one exception: you choose additional favored enemies (and languages) at 10th level and 16th level instead of at 6th level and 14th level.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Survival checks to track your favored enemies, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

description.p: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

sheet.description: Once on each of your turns, you can cause a weapon attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon to the target on a hit.
Once on each of your turns, you can cause a weapon attack to deal an extra 2d8 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon to the target on a hit.

description.p: At 17th level, you can use an action to describe or name a creature that is familiar to you or that you can see within 120 feet. For 24 hours or until the target is dead, whichever occurs first, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track your target and Wisdom (Perception) checks to detect your target. In addition, you have advantage on weapon attack rolls against the target. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.
